newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Guidant rated buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Guidant rated buy.

text.p: -- Dain Bosworth said it initiated coverage of Guidant Corp, which makes medical devices, with a buy rating and a 12-month price target of $60 to $63 a share.
-- Guidant shares were up 5/8 at 43-3/8 in midafternoon exchange trading.

-- "We believe that Guidant's stock is significantly undervalued relative to other cardiovascular medical device companies," Dain said in a report. "Guidant continues to maintain a strong market-share position in the area of tachyarrhythmia (too rapid heart beat) management. It has continually demonstrated the ability to design, develop and launch new and innovative products in a timely manner."

-- Dain said that, based on the October 21 close of 42-3/4, Guidant shares traded at 20.7 times the calendar year 1996 earnings estimate of $2.07 a share, and 16.9 times the calendar year 1997 estimate of $2.53. The stock, it added, is trading at a discount to its long-term growth rate of 20 percent.

-- Dain added that it believes Guidant has the ability to establish a strong market share position in Europe during 1997 and leverage a strong international stent business to offset the weakness in the domestic balloon angioplasty business.
-- A stent is a small tube that is inserted in a blood vessel to support the vessel walls.
